title: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar indulged in anticompetitive tactics and ..., says Infosys in counterclaim agains - The Times of India
summary:
Cognizant CEO Accused of Anticompetitive Tactics by Infosys

Publication Date: (Date unavailable) Source: (Source unavailable)

Infosys has filed a counterclaim against Cognizant, accusing its CEO Ravi Kumar of engaging in anticompetitive practices.

  • Infosys alleges that Cognizant's actions have violated competition laws.
  • The counterclaim could have significant implications for both companies in the tech industry.
  • Ravi Kumar's leadership at Cognizant is now under scrutiny due to these allegations.
“Cognizant's CEO has crossed ethical boundaries in pursuit of market dominance.”

The accusations from Infosys may impact Cognizant's reputation and business operations in the market.
newTitle: Cognizant CEO Accused of Anticompetitive Tactics by Infosys

Decoding India’s growth slowdown - The Hindu
summary:
Decoding India’s growth slowdown

Date & Source: January 10, 2025 - IST

The first advance estimate of India’s GDP in 2024-25 indicates a decline in the real GDP growth rate to 6.4%, down from 8.2% in the previous year. This decline highlights significant issues within the official GDP estimates and the implications of private sector investment trends.

  • The nominal GDP growth is estimated at 9.7% for 2024-25, lower than previous projections.
  • Concerns about the accuracy of GDP estimates due to reliance on the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) as a deflator.
  • Private investment continues to lag, with questions raised about the impact of corporate tax cuts on capital formation.
  • The growth in real gross fixed capital formation is projected to decline significantly.
  • The fiscal situation reflects challenges in achieving revenue and expenditure targets, raising concerns over public spending and growth sustainability.
“There is absolutely no indication of any structural break in the investment behaviour of the private corporate sector so far under the 11 years of NDA rule.” - Prasenjit Bose

The analysis of India's macroeconomic fundamentals underscores the need for a reevaluation of investment strategies and a renewed focus on achieving balanced growth amidst rising fiscal strains.

title: New Honda SUV Finally Launched In India! - MotorOctane
summary:
New Honda Elevate SUV Launched in India!

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

The Honda Elevate has officially been launched in India with new cosmetic updates and two limited edition models. The launch comes after Honda's absence from the Auto Expo.

  • Available in Black Edition and Signature Black Edition models.
  • Features new exterior color schemes and upgraded interiors.
  • Price for the Black edition starts from Rs 18.15 lakh.
  • Rivals include Hyundai Creta Knight Edition and Kia Seltos X-Line.
“The new Elevate Black Edition will continue to offer a 10.25-inch touchscreen system, premium leatherette upholstery, and more.”

In conclusion, the Honda Elevate's new offerings aim to enhance its sporty character and compete effectively in the SUV market in India.
newTitle: New Honda Elevate SUV Launched in India

title: Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants - CarDekho
summary:
Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants

Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The updated Tata Nexon has been launched in India featuring two new colour options and three new variants, while the previous Fearless Purple colour has been discontinued.

  • Prices start from Rs 8 lakh (ex-showroom).
  • New colours: Grassland Beige and Royal Blue.
  • Introduced variants: Pure Plus, Creative, and Creative Plus PS.
  • No changes to exterior and interior design.
  • Maintains turbo-petrol, diesel, and CNG powertrain options.
“The Nexon continues to impress with its extensive feature list and competitive pricing.”

The MY2025 update enhances the Tata Nexon's offering, ensuring it remains a strong contender in the sub-4m SUV market.
newTitle: Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants

Oil News: Crude Prices Surge as Supply Risks Drive Bullish Momentum - FX Empire
summary:
Oil News: Crude Prices Surge as Supply Risks Drive Bullish Momentum

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Industry Reports

Market dynamics are leaning towards an increase in crude prices due to supply chain concerns stemming from geopolitical tensions and rising demand for heating fuel caused by cold weather.

  • Potential sanctions on Russia and Iran could tighten global oil supplies.
  • Analysts project a significant increase in global oil demand driven by heightened consumption for heating.
  • Crude prices are rising despite a stronger U.S. dollar.
  • Optimistic forecasts regarding China’s economic recovery add to bullish market sentiment.
“Longer term, the market is focused on the prospect of additional sanctions.” - Ole Hansen, Saxo Bank

The surge in crude prices highlights the intricate relationship between geopolitical events and market dynamics, underscoring the need for stakeholders to remain vigilant.
newTitle: Crude Oil Prices Rise Amid Supply Risks and Cold Weather Demands

title: PCBL Chemical Q3 Results | Net profit slides 39%, revenue up 21%; declares dividend of ₹5.50 - CNBCTV18
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman's controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’ | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Amid ongoing controversy over L&T chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour work week remark, Rajiv Bajaj, Managing Director of Bajaj Auto, emphasized the importance of quality of work over quantity, suggesting that if a 90-hour week is to be enforced, it should start from the top management.

  • Rajiv Bajaj stated, 'Let 90 hours start from the top' during an interview with CNBC-TV18.
  • S N Subrahmanyan's comments about working on weekends sparked backlash, with many industrialists and politicians voicing their concerns.
  • Bajaj criticized the notion of long hours, advocating for improved outcomes through better leadership and empowerment of employees.
  • RPG Group’s Harsh Goenka also spoke against the excessive work hours, calling for a balanced work-life approach.
  • L&T clarified that Subrahmanyan's comments were intended to inspire extraordinary efforts for the nation's progress.
“Number of hours of work doesn’t matter, quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before.” - Rajiv Bajaj

In conclusion, the discourse surrounding work hours continues to evolve, balancing productivity demands with the necessity for employee well-being.
newTitle: Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

title: SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows - Upstox
summary:
SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows

Date: Friday, Publication Source: Not specified

Equity benchmark indices SENSEX and NIFTY faced losses for the third consecutive session due to concerns over economic growth and rising crude oil prices.

  • SENSEX dropped 241.30 points to close at 77,378.91.
  • NIFTY fell by 95 points to settle at 23,431.50.
  • Major laggards included IndusInd Bank, NTPC, and Tata Steel.
  • Tata Consultancy Services reported nearly a 6% increase in net profit.
  • FIIs sold off equities worth ₹7,170.87 crore on Thursday.
  • Global markets, including Asian and European stocks, closed lower.
“Surging crude oil prices and a strengthening dollar index contributed to the weak trend in equities.”

The persistent losses in SENSEX and NIFTY reflect broader concerns regarding economic conditions and market performance.
newTitle: SENSEX and NIFTY Continue to Decline Amid Rising Crude Prices

title: Q3 results next week: Infosys, Wipro, Axis Bank among over 60 companies to release earnings report - Upstox
summary:
Q3 Earnings Reports: Infosys, Wipro, Axis Bank and More Set to Release Results Next Week

Publication Date: January 13-17, 2025
Source: Upstox

The earnings season for the third quarter of FY25 is underway, with over 60 companies, including major players in the IT sector, set to announce their quarterly results next week. Investors are keenly awaiting these reports as they provide insights into the companies' performance and future outlook.

  • Major companies releasing earnings include Infosys, Wipro, HCL Technologies, and Axis Bank.
  • HCL Technologies will report its results on January 12.
  • Infosys is expected to show a revenue of ₹41,278 crore for Q3 on January 16.
  • Wipro's projected revenue for the December quarter is ₹22,040 crore, scheduled for January 17.
  • Axis Bank anticipates reporting a total income of ₹20,118 crore on the same day as Infosys.
  • The earnings are anticipated to reflect the economic conditions and business strategies moving forward.
“Investors will focus on management commentary on performance, outlook for the present quarter, profit numbers, and new deal wins.”

This earnings season is crucial for investors as the results are expected to highlight the resilience and adaptability of these companies in a changing economic environment.
newTitle: Q3 Earnings Reports: Infosys, Wipro, Axis Bank and More Set to Release Results Next Week

title: Exclusive: Foxconn stops sending Chinese workers to India iPhone factories - Rest of World
summary:
Foxconn Halts Chinese Worker Rotations to Indian iPhone Factories

Publication Date: August 2023 | Source: Rest of World

Foxconn is ceasing the rotation of its Chinese workers to its iPhone production facilities in India and instead relocating Taiwanese staff, causing potential disruptions to assembly lines and equipment shipments.

  • Foxconn is halting new rotations for Chinese employees in India.
  • Shipments of manufacturing equipment from China to India are delayed.
  • Apple aims to diversify production to reduce reliance on China.
  • The issue may be linked to actions from the Chinese government.
“Many in India will read this in a very negative light, whether or not the Chinese government is involved directly.”

This development underscores the challenges Apple faces as it expands manufacturing in India while managing geopolitical tensions between the U.S. and China.
newTitle: Foxconn Halts Chinese Worker Rotations to Indian iPhone Factories

title: Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data - The Hindu
summary:
Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data

Published: January 10, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

India’s industrial production (IIP) growth accelerated to a six-month high of 5.2% year-on-year in November 2024, driven by increased festive demand and a pick-up in the manufacturing sector.

  • The IIP recorded a growth of 2.5% in November 2023.
  • Previous high growth rate was 6.3% in May 2024.
  • Growth in factory output for April-November 2024 was 4.1% compared to 6.5% in the previous year.
  • Manufacturing sector growth accelerated to 5.8% in November from 1.3% a year ago.
  • Consumer durable goods production grew by 13.1% during November 2024.
  • Infrastructure/construction goods reported a growth of 10% in the same month.
"The capital goods segment growth accelerated to 9 percent in November 2024 against a contraction of 1.1% in the year-ago period."

The data indicates a significant recovery in the industrial sector, highlighting the importance of consumer demand during the festive season.
newTitle: Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data

MG Confirms To Showcase 4 New Cars At BMGE 2025 - All Details - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
MG Confirms To Showcase 4 New Cars At BMGE 2025 - All Details

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: GaadiWaadi

MG Motor India is set to unveil four new models at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo (BMGE) 2025, highlighting its vision for the future of mobility under the theme “Drive.Future.” The event will take place between January 17 and 22.

  • Featured models include the Cyberster, M9, iML6, and MG 7 Trophy.
  • The MG Cyberster is a fast electric roadster with a range of 580 km.
  • The M9 MPV boasts premium features like reclining ottoman seats and a range of 430 km.
  • The iML6 sedan offers exceptional safety with over 1,000 km range and ultra-fast charging capabilities.
  • The MG 7 Trophy is a stylish fastback sports sedan with advanced connectivity.
“The Cyberster will target the electric sports car segment in India.”

MG’s showcase at BMGE 2025 emphasizes its commitment to innovation in electric vehicle technologies and advanced features aimed at enhancing user experience.
newTitle: MG Unveils Plans for 4 New Cars at BMGE 2025

Laxmi Dental IPO: 10 key points to consider before ₹698 crore offer opening - Upstox
summary:
Laxmi Dental IPO: 10 Key Points to Consider Before ₹698 Crore Offer Opening

Publication Date: January 13
Source: Upstox

The ₹698 crore IPO of Laxmi Dental is opening for public subscription on January 13. The price band is set between ₹407 and ₹428 per share, with shares expected to be listed on January 20.

  • The IPO subscription period runs from January 13 to January 15.
  • Anchor investors can bid on January 10.
  • The IPO involves new equity shares worth ₹138 crore and an offer-for-sale of 1.31 crore shares worth ₹506.06 crore.
  • Price band is set at ₹407 to ₹428 per share.
  • 75% of shares are reserved for qualified institutional buyers, 15% for non-institutional investors, and 10% for retail investors.
  • Minimum investment size is ₹14,124 for one lot of 33 shares.
  • Funds raised will be used to clear debt and purchase new machinery.
  • Book-running lead managers include SBI Capital Markets and Motilal Oswal.
  • Allotment date is expected on January 16.
  • Shares will be listed on the NSE and BSE on January 20.

Laxmi Dental specializes in B2B2C dental aligner solutions, including custom crowns and advanced digital dentistry.

title: Jio Financial Services sets board meeting date to declare Q3FY25 results. Details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Jio Financial Services Schedules Board Meeting for Q3FY25 Results

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Jio Financial Services has announced a board meeting for January 17, 2025, to declare its Q3 FY25 earnings.

Key Points:

  • The meeting will consider standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ending December 31, 2024.
  • Jio Financial Services reported a 3.1% increase in consolidated net profit for Q2, reaching ₹689 crore.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 14% in Q2 to ₹693.5 crore.
  • Jio Financial Services shares declined 17% in the last month, despite a 16% gain over the past year.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Pursuant to Regulation 29 and other applicable provisions of the Securities and Exchange Board of India, please note that a meeting of the Board of Directors is scheduled.”

Conclusion:

Jio Financial Services is poised to present its Q3 results amid mixed financial performance and stock price fluctuations. Investors will be looking at this meeting for insights into the company's future trajectory.
newTitle: Jio Financial Services Schedules Board Meeting for Q3FY25 Results

title: More VRRs, swaps, OMO buys needed from RBI to address rupee's tightening liquidity: Nomura - Moneycontrol
summary:
More VRRs, swaps, OMO buys needed from RBI to address rupee's tightening liquidity: Nomura

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

According to the report, RBI has been intervening "heavily" in the FX over the past two months, causing a drain on the INR liquidity.

  • Nomura emphasizes the need for more Variable Rate Reverse repos (VRRs), swaps, and Open Market Operations (OMOs) by the RBI.
  • There are indications that further Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) cuts might be necessary.
  • The intervention by RBI in the foreign exchange market has significantly impacted liquidity in the Indian rupee.
“Further CRR cuts cannot be ruled out and that alternative measures look more likely now.”

This analysis underscores the need for the RBI to adopt additional measures to stabilize the rupee liquidity and prevent negative economic impacts.
newTitle: RBI Needs More VRRs, Swaps, and OMO Buys to Address Rupee's Liquidity Issues: Nomura

title: L&T Chairman, under fire for 90-hour work week comments, received Rs 51 crore pay in FY24 - The Times of India
L&T Chairman, under fire for 90-hour work week comments, received Rs 51 crore pay in FY24 - The Times of India
Rupee may fall past 90 per dollar as RBI ditches quasi-peg, says research - The Economic Times
summary:
Rupee May Fall Past 90 Per Dollar as RBI Ditches Quasi-Peg, Says Research

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gavekal Research

The Indian rupee may fall past 90 per dollar this year as the Reserve Bank of India prepares to abandon its quasi-peg to the dollar, according to analysts.

  • The rupee might depreciate by around 10%, potentially reaching 95.
  • The Reserve Bank of India is tasked with lowering interest rates while managing the currency's decline.
  • Recent trends show the rupee hitting record lows, leading to speculation about changes in RBI's currency policy.
  • A long-term correction of the rupee could benefit India by boosting exports.
“In the longer term, a correction of India’s overvalued currency may be a healthy development, especially if it helps India to boost its fledging export economy.”

This shift in policy from the RBI under the new Governor Sanjay Malhotra could reshape India’s economic landscape.
newTitle: Rupee May Fall Past 90 Per Dollar as RBI Ditches Quasi-Peg, Says Research

title: 450% DIVIDEND announcement by power company in Q3 results; record date FIXED - ET Now
summary:
CESC Ltd Announces 450% Dividend in Q3 Results; Record Date Set

Updated: January 10, 2025 15:49 IST

CESC Ltd, an integrated power utilities company, has declared a significant interim dividend for its shareholders, showcasing strong performance in its Q3 FY2025 financial results.

  • CESC Ltd announced a 450% dividend, translating to a payout of Rs 4.50 per share.
  • The record date for shareholders to be eligible for the dividend is set for January 16, 2025.
  • The company's consolidated net profit for Q3 FY2025 was reported at Rs 282 crore, compared to Rs 301 crore in the same period last year.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 10% to Rs 3,561 crore from Rs 3,244 crore a year ago.
  • CESC Ltd shares closed at Rs 162.42, marking a decline of 4.40% on the NSE.
"...declared an interim dividend @ Rs 4.50 per equity share (i.e. 450%) on the paid-up equity share capital of the company payable to those members whose names appear in the Register of Members of the Company..." - CESC Ltd

This announcement highlights CESC Ltd's ongoing commitment to returning value to its shareholders amidst fluctuating financial results.
newTitle: CESC Ltd Announces 450% Dividend in Q3 Results; Record Date Set

title: Standard Glass IPO allotment status: How to check details online via KFin Tech, NSE & BSE; Check... - Moneycontrol
summary:

The Standard Glass IPO allotment status is announced, following a significant subscription rate. Investors can check their allotment status via KFin Technologies and stock exchanges.

  • The allotment is expected to be declared on January 9, with a subscription rate of 183 times.
  • The price band for the shares was Rs 133-140 each.
  • The IPO raised Rs 410.05 crore and received bids for over 381 crore shares.

This IPO reflects strong investor interest and substantial market activity in recent developments.
